fields.description:
*Summary:*
Unable to save a description or comment when a code macro exists and contains two exclamations marks separated by 1 or more characters:

*Screenshot:*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*Code snippet 1:*
{code}
!     testing    !
{code}

*Code snippet 2:*
{code}
if (a !== 1 && b !== c) {
d
}
{code}

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create or go to an existing issue
# Insert code macro
# Insert two exclamation mark with at least one space in between on the same line
# Save

*Expected behaviour*
Comment or Description will save

*Current behaviour*
Comment or Description will  not save

*Workaround:*
Use a maximum of one exclamation mark per line.
fields.summary: [New Issue View] Unable to save Description or Comment when '! !' present in the code macro

fields.description:
Board Settings>Card Layout>Backlog>Add Field Name

 

When fields are added to the card layout, they drop down to a second line making each project line double in size. There is room for this info to be displayed on one line but there is no functionality to force certain fields to the first line. The backlog view becomes really bulky and harder to navigate when the lines double in size.
fields.summary: Add functionality to customize which info can appear on the first line of the card layout backlog view

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

There is inconsistence in the results when performing JQL searches based on the *Resolution*.

h3. *Tests*
* Example #1: issue *AP-10* - Unresolved; issue *AP-1* - Unresolved (but had a resolution set at some point):
** Search #1: *resolution is EMPTY AND project = AP* -> No issue returned
** Search #2: *resolution = unresolved AND project = AP* -> No issue returned
** Search #3: *resolution WAS unresolved AND project = AP* -> No issue returned
** resolution #4:  *resolution WAS EMPTY AND project = AP* -> Issue AP-1 returned

There may be different results in different Jira instances. I was not able to match results between my test instance and a teammate's one, for example.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Search #1: should return AP-10.
Search #2: should return AP-10.
Search #3: if Search #4 returned AP-1, this one should have returned AP-1 as well.


h3. Actual Results

* Search #1: No issue returned
* Search #2: No issue returned
* Search #3: No issue returned

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Inconsistence in JQL searches towards resolution

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no option for JIRA Cloud to disable JIRA Mobile App for that instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option for administrator to disable the JIRA Mobile App.

h3. Workaround

With Atlassian Access, the organization admin can delegate authentication to IdP such as Azure AD and Okta. You may configure the Mobile Device Management (MDM) provided by the IdP.
 * [SAML - Atlassian Access|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/configure-saml-single-sign-on-with-an-identity-provider/]
 * [Configure Okta Mobility Management - Okta|https://help.okta.com/en/prod/Content/Topics/Mobile/Apps_OMM.htm]
 * [Azure Active Directory integration with MDM - Windows Client Management|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/client-management/mdm/azure-active-directory-integration-with-mdm]

Besides, consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Option to disable JIRA Mobile App for that instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the App Switcher in Jira, recently accessed Confluence spaces are showing under "Recent" section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update a Confluence space
# Either delete the space or deactivate Confluence entirely
# Go to Jira
# Open the App switcher 

h3. Expected Results
#  The Confluence spaces should be removed from the App Switcher !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
# The Confluence spaces still appear in the App Switcher despite Confleunce being deactivated or the Spaces deleted 

h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Non
fields.summary: "Recent" Conflence spaces under the "App Switcher" still showing after deletion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Right now there is an option to add a star to a project and it will appear in the *Starred and recent* section on the sidebar but in the projects section of Jira it is not possible to sort projects by *Starred* projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the option to sort projects by the criteria *Starred* or *Not Starred* on the projects section in Jira
fields.summary: Add the option to sort by starred projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When performing a Cloud to Cloud Jira import, the import fails due to PSQLException.

h3. Environment
 - Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate Jira Backup
 # Attempt to import to Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

Jira data is imported successfully
h3. Actual Results

This error message is seen through the UI:
{code:java}
Problems with the JIRA Import Wizard
The import wizard is reporting the following problems:

Error importing data: PSQLException
{code}
Logs show the following:
{code:java}
Error occurred while importing data.

com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:IssueTypeFieldAssociation][issueTypeId,10301][fieldIdentifier,summary][created,2018-07-13 09:52:31.178329][id,1][position,0][category,not_configurable][updated,2018-07-13 09:52:31.178329][required,true] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issue_type_field_association (ID, issuetype_id, field_identifier, field_position, field_category, REQUIRED, default_value, CREATED, UPDATED) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: column "default_value" is of type jsonb but expression is of type character varying Hint: You will need to rewrite or cast the expression. Position: 193))
{code}
h3. Notes

This might seem related to JRACLOUD-68436, as they are both showing the same error through the UI. However, the detailed logs show a different cause, and this one affects Cloud to Cloud imports.
h3. Workaround

No workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira backup import fails due to PSQLException

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 25 November 2019}
The Select List (Cascading) field type is now available in the new issue view.
{panel}

h3. *Problem Definition*
 * Custom field not visible on the Issue view if the Select list (Cascading) field type is used in creating that custom field.

 
{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Create a new custom field of type using the *Select list (cascading)* field type
 - Add that custom field to your screens
 - Set the custom field to any value
 - Create an issue and set some values while creating the issue on the custom field.
 - view the Issue after creation and the custom field is not present on the *new issue view.*
 - switch to the *old issue view* and the custom field is visible.{panel}
h3. *Expected Result*
 * Custom field should be displayed on the right column on the new issue view

h3. *Actual Result*
 * custom field is not visible on the right column of the new issue view

h3. *Work Around*
 * Switch to the Old Issue view to be able to see the custom field.
fields.summary: Custom fields created using the select List (cascading) Field type not visible

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attachments of renamed projects get exported with the old project key in backup
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in an existing project, e.g project key=*ES*
 # Add an attachment to an issue
 # Rename the project key, e.g set new project key to *AA*
 # Generate an export file
 # In the attachments folder, there will be no folder with the *AA* key. There will be a folder with the *ES* key
 # Import the export file to a target instance
 # The project will be created with the new key *AA* and the attachments will be linked to the correct issues

h3. Expected Results

To have attachments folder exported with the updated project key
h3. Actual Results

Attachments folder is created with the old project key
h3. Notes

Jira won't allow any new projects to be created or renamed to a project key which was already in use, i.e *ES*.
fields.summary: Attachments of renamed projects get exported with the old project key in backup

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a requestor fill in the Issue collector form we can match the Jira issue to a *Default reporter* or *Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address* (for existing users). 

Currently, it is not possible to create a Jira user for each issue collector requestor.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a way to configure the issue collector to Create a Jira user for each issue collector requestor. 
* Maybe adding a third option in the screenshot below: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
 * Facilitate adding users on the cloud site. 

h3. Workaround 
* Currently there is no workaround as by design we don't allow to create users.
fields.summary: Allow the option for a Jira Issue Collector to Create a Jira user for New Submissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira will display errors in a popup titled "Some problems need your attention" for multiple reasons. Like permission errors, or hidden fields missing default values etc.

These can be cleared and if a Jira Administrator is not very active in that particular project it may go unnoticed for some time.

h3. Suggested Solution
All of these errors should be included in either the Audit Log or another Error Log somewhere for review.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Errors & warnings should be included in a log

As for our in build workflow validator, there's no option to validate "Component" field.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if there's an option to validate "Component" field.

fields.description:

At the moment a user can only start/stop watching an issue in the Jira mobile app, however, you cannot add other users as watchers to the issue
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to add watchers in the Jira mobile app
fields.summary: Add Watchers through Jira Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira you can set a default dashboard to display to your users, and the users can [individually set what their Jira Homepage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/managing-your-user-profile-939937934.html#Managingyouruserprofile-Choosingyourhomepage] should be, from the following:
* Dashboard
* Issue Navigator
* Rapid Board (available if you're using JIRA Software)

(!) Note: the rapid board option only displays the last viewed board

It is not possible to set a default homepage for all users, other than the option to set a default dashboard.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to set a Jira homepage for all users other than using a dashboard, such as issue navigator (specific filter), or a specific Kanban/Scrum board.
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to set a default Jira homepage other than a dashboard

fields.description: We need the Dev Team to manage their sub-tasks but not be able create Stories. Not being able to restrict that means that either the Product Owner has to create ALL sub-tasks on behalf of the team or the PO has to constantly keep an eye out to make sure no one else creates Stories because giving access to create sub-tasks also gives access to create Stories. This is a very combative situation for the team and PO. Please prioritize this for sooner than later as it's obvious this is needed because "{color:#333333}Automation for Jira Lite{color}" Add-on is being used to fix this after the creation by a lot of Jira users.
fields.summary: Restricting create access by Issue Type

fields.description:

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the notification emails to use the Issue Link events.

- Issue Link created

fields.summary: Issue link event notification email

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When a Slack channel is connected to a Jira project where the Issue security level is applied:
** we can configure the integration notifications to not be sent for Jira issue with *"Top Secret"* Issue Security level. 
** However, we noticed that for Jira issues where the *"Top Secret"* is applied we still can get a preview of it unexpectedly. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that you have a Jira project with more than one Issue security level (one of them let's call it "top secret"). 
# Ensure to add Project Role *atlassian-addons-project-access* to the *top secret* Issue security level. 
# Ensure to have at least one Jira issue set with the top secret as Issue security level. 
# Ensure that the user who will make the tests is not allowed to browse that specific Jira issue. 
# Integrate your private Slack channel to the Jira project. 
# Ensure to configure the integration between the Jira project and the Slack channel to NOT receive notifications for *top secret*. 
# Add a comment and validate that you did not receive a notification. 
# On your slack channel try to call the Jira issue where the top secret Issue security level is applied: /jira BAN-1
#* You are supposed to receive the following message: Issue BAN-1 not found
#* You will receive the following message that include data related to the *status*, *type*, *Priority*,  *assignee* and "title". 
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

* Next: remove the Project Role (atlassian-addons-project-access) from the top secret Issue security level. 
* Try to call again the same Jira issue where the top secret Issue security level is applied: /jira BAN-1
** You will not receive any preview related to this Jira issue as expected.
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
*  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* As described in the *Steps to Reproduce* section, this occurs only when the Project Role *atlassian-addons-project-access* is mapped to the issue security level: 
**  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  

h3.Workaround
* Ensure to remove the  Project Role *atlassian-addons-project-access* from the issue security level.
fields.summary: Slack user is able to get Jira issue data he is not authorized to see based on Issue security level

fields.description: As of this moment, the Trello importer doesn’t have any details or notification regarding the limited functionality of Next-Gen projects. This can cause a feature misunderstanding that could waste time and cause confusion regarding "missing" functionality.
fields.summary: Trello Importer should have details regarding the limitations of Next-Gen Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The code macro for xml does not properly highlight commented out lines if the comment contains an xml tag. The syntax highlighting is looking for > instead of --> to end the comment highlight. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a comment or issue body with the bellow macro content:
{noformat}
{code:xml}
<xml1>some stuff</xml1>
<!--comment with no tags-->
<!--<xml1>comment with tags</xml1>
{code}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The commented line highlighting should extend all the way up to and including the -->

h3. Actual Results
The comment highlighting ends incorrectly with the first > in the line 
 
h3. Notes
What ever logic being used for comment highlighting seems to be looking only for > to signal the end of the commented line instead of -->

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Code macro for xml does not properly syntax highlight comments

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 20 July 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We recognise the importance of this issue and are currently investigating a solution as part of a larger initiative we are working on to enable admins to group fields (including add ons such as Tempo) on the right side of the issue view. Each user will be able to choose which groups are visible (or hidden) by expanding (or collapsing) them (therefore removing the need to click on Tempo if the applicable group is expanded). 

Please watch this ticket for updates as we progress

The Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

In the new Jira issue view, the Tempo time tracking field is hidden by default. Users needs to click on Tempo to expose the time tracking data.

!tempo.png|thumbnail! 
 !time tracking.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the Tempo field to be exposed by default
h3. Why this is important

Customers that heavily used the Tempo data requires an extra click on every Jira issue.
fields.summary: Allow the Tempo field to be exposed by default

fields.description:
One very annoying issue for someone that has Jira open the entire day, is to have someone making changes to an issue, like a transition change, and not see that change unless I reload the page.

It would be a huge improvement if some of the changes could trigger a push notification via web sockets to others.
fields.summary: Notify of changes through web sockets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * By design, Jira keeps a record of old issue keys when an issue is moved or a project key is changed
 * When a project key is changed, Jira creates issue keys for _each_ project key that has ever existed for the project that the issue is currently in. Example:
{quote} * Project A, which is then renamed to B, then to C, then to D...
 * Then issue D is created with the issue key D-100.
 * Then the issue is moved to project FOO, and now has the issue key FOO-42

The records in the "moved_issue_key" in the Jira database will contain records for A, B, C (even though the issue never was in the project at the time), i.e. it will be discoverable as A-100, B-100, C-100, D-100 and FOO-42.
{quote}
 * Jira allows searching of old issue keys
 * This is fine, however, if a customer is using an old list of issue keys, there may be some discrepancies in the results or unintended results
 * The results may be confusing or if a customer chooses to make a bulk change, then that action could have unintended results

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow Jira to keep a longer record of project key/issue key changes and make that data available to users in Jira
 * Show the move/change history in Issue Navigator
 * Show the move/change history in a field which in turn will be displayed in the JQL query results(column)

h3. Why this is important
 * When searching using JQL, it's not always clear if the returned search query contains issues that have been moved and are no longer relevant to the query
 * On a side note: this discrepancy can only occur if old issue keys are explicitly referenced by the user or in an old comment/issue description, summary, custom field etc.

h3. Workaround
 * Find the "issue id" of an issue by hovering on any of the buttons on the full issue view and looking at the URL(usually displayed at the bottom of the browser), e.g. https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/EditIssue!default.jspa?id=2472909.  The "issue id" is 2472909.  Once the "issue id" has been obtained, then the JQL query can be run as so:
{noformat}
issue in (2472909,2472908)
{noformat}
 * Contact Jira Cloud Support for information regarding issue history
fields.summary: In the Issue Navigator and full issue view, make it easy for users to see the full history of changes to the issue key

fields.description:

When looking at backlog or sprint board (Rapid Board) I see in the sidebar under the people dropdown you can assign Reporter and Assignee. The order is *Reporter* above *Assignee*.

When I look at the card page. eg:jira.com/browse/xxxx-1234 the order under the people dropdown is *Assignee* above *Reporter*.

 This can be extremely frustrating.

Thanks so much

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The error "Wait for a few moments, then give it another try" is displayed when linking an issue from a Next-gen project to an issue in a classic project. This happens when the user does not have the "Link issue" permission for the classic project.

h3. Environment
Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove the "Link issue" permission for the user in the classic project.
# Try linking the issue from next-gen project to the classic project issue.

h3. Expected Results
An appropriate error message is displayed hinting to the lack of required permissions to perform the task.

h3. Actual Results
"Wait for a few moments, then give it another try" error is displayed.
fields.summary: Incorrect error message displayed when unable to link issues due to lack of permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When linking an issue between a Next-gen and classic project the user requires the "Link Issues" permission for the classic project whereas when linking an issue between a classic project A and classic project B, the user does not require the "Link Issues" permission for the Project B.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link issues between a next-gen project and classic project where the user does not have "Link Issues" permission for the classic project.
# Link issues between two classic projects where the user does not have "Link Issues" permission for the project.

h3. Expected Results
The expected result is to have the same permission requirements irrespective of the type of project.
h3. Actual Results
There is a difference in the required permissions.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behaviour of link issue permission between Next-gen and classic projects

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results
Have this gadget as an option on Jira.

h3. Actual Results
There is no option to add it.
fields.summary: Have the Option to Add Retrospective Actions from a Confluence page as a widget on a Jira dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an update issue rest call encounters a DB connection error for cloud, an HTTP 400 response code is returned instead of a server error response code or a 429 rate limit code. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Send a PUT https://<site>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/ call against a site that is currently overloaded. 

h3. Expected Results

- A 500 server error or 429 rate limit error should be returned to the client. 
- Have a mechanism to handle this scenario instead of throwing 400 response back for the edit issue call. 

h3. Actual Results

An HTTP 400 (Bad request) response is sent to the client. 

{code}
400	PUT	/rest/api/2/issue/

Exception occurred editing issue: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Exception while inserting the following entity: [GenericEntity:CustomFieldValue][parentkey,null][customfield,xxxxxx][issue,xxxxx][xxxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxxxx] 
(Unable to establish a connection with the database. 
(PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS Exception already occurred in this workcontext, skipping next getConnection)) 
{code}
fields.summary: HTTP 400 response code when DB connection error is encountered

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to configure Jira Cloud to [send mail on behalf of a custom domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html], if the domain entered into domain-check.atlassian.com starts with a numeral the check will fail and a HTTP 422 (Unprocessable Entity) error will be returned in the browser dev console. In addition, if you attempt to configure a custom project e-mail address in JIRA using a claimed domain that begins with a numeral this will also fail and return an error stating 'DKIM/SPF validation error.' This occurs despite the SPF and DKIM DNS configuration being correct.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://domain-check.atlassian.com|https://domain-check.atlassian.com/]
 # Enter a domain that starts with a numeral (ex. 2wire.com, 99perblems.com)
 # Click 'Check' button

Or attempt to configure a custom project e-mail using a claimed domain that start with a numeral
 # Choose the Jira icon (  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613716/1/1520474494630/core.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613719/1/1520474554077/software.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613718/1/1520474568265/servicedesk.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/959785988/1/1538713322379/Jira+Ops-icon-neutral-rgb%402x.png|width=16!  or   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613717/1/1520474599238/jirafamily.png|width=19! ) > *Projects*.
 # Select *Settings* > *Summary.*
 # Under the *Notifications* section and click the pencil icon to the right of the *Email* address.
 # In the resulting *Project Email Address* dialog box, enter a valid email address in the *Email* field, and click *Update*.

h3. Expected Results

SPF\DKIM records are verified or found to be missing
 The project e-mail is set successfully.
h3. Actual Results

'Unknown server error' is displayed.
 Checking the browser dev console, a HTTP 422 error is returned.
{code:java}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 422 ()
 index.js:83 Error: Request failed with status code 422
 at e.exports (createError.js:15)
 at e.exports (settle.js:18)
 at XMLHttpRequest.d.(/anonymous function) (https://domain-check.atlassian.com/static/js/main.748193d6.js:4:8199)\{code}
{code}
 Attempting to set the project e-mail results in 'DKIM/SPF validation error.'
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: DKIM\SPF Validation Fails for Domains That Start With a Numeral

fields.description:
*Summary*
There's no way to monitor access/activity besides last logged in date for each user.

*Suggestion*
Allow Administrators to track access on specific projects by the users.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to track access/activity from users on specific projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Submitting a comment without network connectivity causes the comment to disappear on Adroid Jira Mobile

h3. Environment
Android Jira Mobile App

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start entering a comment
# Enable airplane mode
# Try to submit the comment
# Notice the comment has disappeared

h3. Expected Results
* Comment remains in the comment box like on iOS and can be re-submitted once connectivity is restored


h3. Actual Results
The comment disappears
 
h3. Notes
Unique scenario of when someone is entering a large comment and hits send just as they lose network connectivity


h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Submitting a comment without network connectivity causes the comment to disappear on Android Jira Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

Invalid Value passed for customfield error when creating issue from backlog view on board

h3. Steps to replicate:
 # Create 2 or more Custom Fields where the same option is used. 
 # Click *_Create issue_* in Backlog view
 # Type in summary (in the _What needs to be done?_ field) and press _Enter_

h3. Expected Result:
Issue is created and is added to the Backlog.

h3. Actual Result:

The create screen is presented with error: *_Please fix fields marked below_*
 And error under that XXXX custom field:  *_Invalid Value 'YYYY' passed for customfield 'XXXX'._*

h3. Workaround:
Remove options that are also used in other Custom Fields
fields.summary: Invalid value 'YYYY' passed for customfield error when creating issue from backlog view on board

fields.description:
There is a business need to enhance the date picker field to function with blackout dates (ie, date picker would black out earlier days and only make days available from x+5days on).

 

Picture describes the feature, just not exactly the functionality I would need.  We have service requests come though that take 5 days to complete, but because the field is just a standard date picker they can request the task to be completed in 2 days even though its not actually possible.   This feature would eliminate a lot of confusion / set clear expectations. 

 

Ex:  Opened the date picker on Oct25th but the 26th, 27th, 28th, 29th, and 30th would be blacked out and the 1st available date to select for a due date would be Oct 31st. 

 

!image-2018-10-25-11-14-45-754.png!
fields.summary: Date picker with blackout dates

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Uploaded image for project: 'JIRA Cloud (including JIRA Core)'



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter with the following JQL : {{project = PROJECT order by created desc}}
# Use a *Time Since Chart* gadget and configure it to use the created filter
# Click on any of the Time bars

 !Time bar.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The issue navigator will load with the resulting issues.

h3. Actual Results

The issue navigator will load with an error because the "order by created" clause is duplicated

 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Use a filter that does not contain the "order by created" clause
fields.summary: Time Since Chart adds 'created DESC' even if it's already in the filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bulk rest api calls that fails with DB connection errors is returning a 403 response code to the client. 

1. Content response is even more misleading :

{code}
<html>
<head>
    <title>Forbidden (403)</title> 
<!--[if IE]><![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript" >
{code}

2. Jira application logs indicates DB connection error from too many request within a short period of time. 

{code}
ERROR	com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper	
Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: 
Unable to establish a connection with the database. (PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS Exception already occurred in this workcontext, skipping next getConnection)
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call REST APIs  in continuous succession

h3. Expected Results

If the rate limit is hit, the status 429. Throttling limit state should be returned in headers like [here|https://developers.trello.com/docs/rate-limits]

h3. Actual Results

HTTP 403 response code returned with the following content 

{code}
<html>
<head>
    <title>Forbidden (403)</title> 
<!--[if IE]><![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript" >
{code}
fields.summary: HTTP Status 403 returned for DB connection error when calling REST APIs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Considering the fact that we want only the users to use the sub-task we created, it would be good if we could change from "Create sub-task" to the "Create sub-change" for example, that is the name of the sub-task we created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow administrators to change the name of the option in the three dots option.

h3. Why this is important
It would be easier and not make the users confused about the option.
fields.summary: Display the Name of the Sub-task in the Button to Create Sub-tasks

"Attachments" heading is not i18n friendly

fields.description:
When creating issues from an Epic, labels aren't inherited

Expected:

Our Epics all have labels. When creating issues (like stories) as a child of the epic, those labels are not inherited. This should be a flag that Jira admin can set to turn on/off inherited fields, in this case labels.

Actual:

We have to manually retype labels into the label field even for inherited issues.
fields.summary: When creating issues from an Epic, labels aren't inherited

fields.description:
*Summary*
Recently Created Chart gadget, sorting Daily, displays the results shifted one day back

*Steps to Reproduce*
Have a Recently Created Chart gadget with a daily period, create and resolve issues today.

*Expected Results*
The bar displaying today's stats should increase, reflecting tickets created and resolved today

*Actual Results*
The bar from the day before increases, erroneously displaying today's progress as yesterday's
fields.summary: Recently Created Chart gadget, sorting Daily, displays the results shifted one day

fields.description:
h3. Description

Jira User Interface at out of norm resolution level or zoom level seems to break scaling of the User Interface
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Set scaling at 150% at the screen
 # First scenario - missing top right menu at Filter Issues
 ## Go to any filter from dashboard
 ## Go to the filter issues
 ## On any issue - scroll down to the end , click comment till pop up appears
 ## Try to comment
 ## Then you will see that you can no longer see the top right menu
 ## However , when you zoom to 80-90%, the menu appears
 # Second scenario - trying to paste an attachment using ctrl-v
 ## Try to add attachment at an issue
 ##  It becomes impossible to click "upload".
 ## However , when you zoom to 80-90%, the button appears. 

h3. Expected Result

Zooming or scaling should ensure menus. buttons appear
h3. Actual Result

In both cases there is a missing element when scaled to 150% . The elements we noticed thus far is top right menu and attachment button.
h3. Workaround

Zoom out or scale the resolution enough to display properly.
fields.summary: JIRA User Interface Disrupts When Scaling at Higher then Default Zoom or Resolution level

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the current state of Jira cloud, an admin needs to manually check any association before a group can be safely deleted. 

- permission schemes
- email notification schemes
- issue security levels
- saved filters.

This requires a lot of manual effort on big implementations and the database access is not available for administrators

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a warning that shows all association in Jira cloud before a group can be deleted.
fields.summary: Warning for associations within Jira before a group can be deleted

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Error message accumulates while running an incorrect JQL for a Filter and refreshing the search
!Screen Shot 2018-10-24 at 20.39.11.png|thumbnail! 
*Steps to reproduce the issue:*
# Open 'All Issues' in 'Issues and filters' side menu.
# Customize filter- Reporter should not exist.
# Observe the error message by refreshing.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show error message just a single time.

h3. Why this is important
This will help users to troubleshoot the issue better.
fields.summary: Error message accumulates  while running an incorrect JQL for a Filter

fields.description:
If the only link on an issue is a link to a Confluence page or some other external page there is no option to copy this link when cloning the issue.

*To Reproduce*
# Create an issue in JIRA.
# Link the issue to a Confluence page
# Clone the JIRA issue.

*Result*
In the Clone Issue dialog there is no checkbox to copy issue links.
 !Clone_issue__KAN-87_-_no_link.png|thumbnail! 

*Expected*
The checkbox should be shown to copy issue links.
 !Clone_issue__KAN-87_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

*Workaround*
# On the issue you want to clone, add a link to a different JIRA issue (just don't use 'clones' or 'is cloned by' types)
# Now when you clone there is a checkbox to copy links.  Check the box.  The Confluence/external link will be copied along with the JIRA issue link.
# After cloning, remove the unwanted JIRA issue link.
fields.summary: When cloning an Issue, issue links can not be copied unless there is a linked Issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User Management does not get synced with Jira causing any changes in user management e.g. new user created or group membership changes won't be reflected in Jira. The new user won't be able to log in. New site admin, however, can still reach user management administration page.
fields.summary: User Management does not get synced with Jira

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If a user has comma in it's username (e.g. *user,name*), mention notifications won't be sent to it.

*PS.* Other notifications are not affected.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a user that has comma in its username;
# Mention that user in an issue.

h3. Expected Results

The user will receive the notification when mentioned.

h3. Actual Results

The mention notification won't be sent.

h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: User with comma in its username won't receive mention notifications

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When exporting the user list to CSV, the importer won't handle it properly.

*Example*:
* Have a user with username = *user,name*;
* Export the users to CSV in the user management;
* Since there is a comma in the username, it will impact in the CSV row for that user, since the comma is the default delimiter:
** Notice that the username will be divided in two columns. And because of that, all the other information will be wrongly positioned, even putting information in an additional column:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-24 at 09.09.38.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-10-24 at 09.09.58.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a user with comma in it's username;
# Export the Users to CSV in the user management.

h3. Expected Results

The username should not be divided. When there is a string with comma, it should be exported in quotes: *"user,name"*.

h3. Actual Results

The string is divided in two columns, impacting in the whole row for that user in the CSV

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: User CSV export does not treat usernames with comma properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Some Jira users cannot use the _Copy Filter_ functionality.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Navigate to the list of all filters, locate one filter and on its right-hand side click the three-dotted button, then click *Copy Filter*

h3. Expected Results
A copy of the filter is created

h3. Actual Results
An error message saying "Something went wrong"


h3.Workaround
Click on the filter's name to actually execute the search. After that, click on *Save As* at the top of the page to save the same JQL with a different name (actually creating a copy of the desired filter).
fields.summary: cannot copy filter

fields.description:
I does not receive email notifications about changes in my tickets since October, 18.
I did not change any settings in my profile. I went to my personal settings and found that "Notifications of your changes" is set to "Do not notify me". I tried to change it but received "Something went wrong. Try again" message.

How I can enable again email notifications?
fields.summary: Email notifications stopped without unexpectedly

fields.description:
h3. Tracked here: JSWCLOUD-16508
h3. Summary

If the system or user language is changed to Czech then date fields will stop working correctly.
 The date picker will return the value {{19/X/18}}, once you submit the form data the following error will be shown:
 - 
{code:java}
Nezadali jste platné datum. Prosím, zadejte datum ve formátu "d/MMM/yy", např. "19/Říj/18"{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Try starting a sprint
 or
 * Try logging work or add a due date

h3. Expected Results

JIRA accepts the date format returned by the date picker
h3. Actual Results
{code:java}
Nezadali jste platné datum. Prosím, zadejte datum ve formátu "d/MMM/yy", např. "19/Říj/18"{{code}
h3. Workaround

Change the month abbreviation from X to Říj ({{19/Říj/18}})
fields.summary: Date picker does not work with Czech language

fields.description:
Currently the *Introduction* message gadget is displayed to anyone accessing the URL:

'https://<instance_name.atlassian.net>/secure/Dashboard.jspa'

Sometimes this introduces a security concern, so please provide the option to restrict the Introduction message to certain users as well as have the option to delete this gadget from the System dashboard.
fields.summary: Provide the option to restrict/delete the Introduction (welcome) message displayed on the System dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Description
Whenever creating issues or a project using the *External System Import* feature, Jira may automatically select an invalid issue type if the instance contains multiple issue types with the same name (which may happen if next-gen projects exist).

h3. How to reproduce
 # Go to *Jira Settings > System > External System import*
 # Select CSV 
 # Choose the *Defined in CSV* option to create a new project in the process
 # Upload the file that contains both the project's and issues' definitions
 # Map the fields accordingly
 # Import the issue

h3. Expected Behavior
 * In case the Issue Type Scheme contained multiple records of the same issue type (one from a *Next-Gen project* and the other a "regular" issue type, Jira should recognize the proper issue type to be used

h3. Actual Behavior
 * Jira chooses the incorrect issue type to be used, causing the issue to use an invalid issue type
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-23 at 5.29.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 ** The *Story* issue type in the picture is from a *Next-Gen* project
fields.summary: External System Import may choose invalid issue type when importing CSV

fields.description:
Currently the time tracking in Jira does not respect any form of time/day. This allows users to be able to submit times like 40 hours in a single update. Because these updates do not have any time-date association, it means that it is possible for users to imply more time than there is in a day to be submitted.

As an admin, We would like to be able to impose a limit on how much time can be submitted in an update based on the existing working-hours settings.

I would also like to suggest adding the option to impose calendar information for the hours. (such as date/time to date/time, then calculate the time based on that).
fields.summary: Limit Time Tracking in Jira to 24-hours per day.

fields.description:
h3.Summary

JQL will search by last text field value even when field value was set to empty.


h3.Step to Replicate
# Create a ticket with a custom text field in it. Populate the field with 'ToDo'.
# Edit the ticket and remove the text field value.
# Go to the issue navigator and run the query below.
{noformat}
field1 ~ "ToDo"
{noformat}
# The issue will be returned despite it being empty. The JQL is also checking the issue history.
# Go back to the issue and change the text field value to 'Test'.
# Run the JQL query again from the issue navigator again.
# This time the issue will not be returned.

h3.Expected Result
Jira should not be querying against last non empty field value when the field that is specified in the clause is empty.

h3.Current Result
Jira is querying against issue last non empty field value when the field that is specified in the clause is empty.
fields.summary: JQL will search by last text field value even when field value was set to empty

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding a link that has too many special characters in the comment field, it fails with the following error:

{quote}
(x) *We couldn't save your comment*
It might be empty, too long, or have invalid
formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the
formatting and adding it directly in the editor.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in a board
# Type following link as comment and save it 
https://test.test.com/app/test#/discover?_g=(refreshInterval:(display:Off,pause:!f,value:0),time:(from:'2018-10-21T18:50:00.000Z',mode:absolute,to:'2018-10-21T18:51:00.000Z'))&_a=(columns:!(tag,level,message),filters:!(('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!f,index:'27811530-f178-11e7-8a66-0fade6d0aba7',key:instance_id,negate:!f,params:(query:i-092f047d5af921a35,type:phrase),type:phrase,value:i-092f047d5af921a35),query:(match:(instance_id:(query:i-092f047d5af921a35,type:phrase))))),index:'27811530-f178-11e7-8a66-0fade6d0aba7',interval:auto,query:(language:lucene,query:'tag:origin'),sort:!('@timestamp',desc))

h3. Expected Results
Comment saves

h3. Actual Results
Following error appears in UI and browser's console:
 !Error Board.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
In the full issue view, adding the comment works.
fields.summary: Add Comment in the New Issue View on Board that has Too Many Special Characters Return Erros

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot choose a parent when bulk converting a huge number of issues into sub-tasks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 500 issues in a project
# Do a JQL on the 500 issues and initiate the bulk update
# Choose the move operation and switch the issues to *sub-tasks*
# Click on the Parent issue drop down

h3. Expected Results

The list of possible parent issues should be displayed

h3. Actual Results

The Parent drop down fails with 400 error and the message. 
{quote}
The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
{quote}


 !parent error.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Split the issues using the JQL and bulk convert the issues in smaller batches.
fields.summary: Unable to bulk convert huge number of issues into sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a WebHook is created to fire on a Log Work event (created, updated, deleted) this fails to fire if the log work event happens as part of a transition. 
If work is logged outside of a transition the WebHook fires as expected.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get a WebHook URL from [https://webhook.site]
# Create a WebHook like:  !Screen Shot 2018-10-23 at 10.51.18.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a screen with the 'Log Work' field and associate the screen to a transition:  !Screen Shot 2018-10-23 at 10.51.55.png|thumbnail! 
# Trigger the transition and update the work log field:  !Screen Shot 2018-10-23 at 10.51.18.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
The WebHook will fire and a response will be seen in the test WebHook site.

h3. Actual Results
The WebHook is not fired and no data is posted to the test WebHook site.
 
h3. Notes
Log work WebHook fires OK when done outside of transition. 
I have tested the same thing with a comments WebHook and this did work as expected and was fired during transition

h3.Workaround
Log work outside of the transition.
fields.summary: WebHooks do not fire for 'Log Work' events if triggered as part of a transition.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
 
In the document [Jira Software vs Basecamp 3|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/comparison/jira-vs-basecamp] under *Powerful search and reporting*, there's a typo
 !jiar.JPG|thumbnail! 

h2. Suggested Solution
Please correct the typo from Jiar to Jira
fields.summary: Update Jira Software vs Basecamp 3 document

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bitbucket commits link to new target instance(does not have DVCS connector configured yet) when performing a backup of source instance(which has the original DVCS connector) and importing to the target instance


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Do a site backup of a cloud instance which has a DVCS connector
# Edit the entities.xml file
# Do a restore in new target instance

h3. Expected Results
Bitbucket connected would still link to original instance

h3. Actual Results
BItbucket links to new instance 

*Application logs:*

h3. Notes
This is a very edge case

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Jira cloud to cloud backup/restore process reconfigures the DVCS account link in target instance
Update Jira Software vs Basecamp 3 document

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "Issue Created" notification is not being delivered listeners of the event when a Service Desk issue is created via email with an *inline* image.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the attachments settings and then Disable Thumbnails
# Set the notification scheme to notify users from Role Service Desk Team for issue created event.
# Send an email to JSD mail handler with an *inline* image.

h3. Expected Results
* Jira should process the message and then notify the users.

h3. Actual Results
The message is processed, but the notification is not being sent. The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
msg:	 Error while processing message: MailingListCompiler#sendItem	
    	 stack:	 com.atlassian.mail.MailException: Error while processing message: MailingListCompiler#sendItem
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem.send(IssueMailQueueItem.java:137)
message:	 Failed to send issue notification emails	

{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* If you attach the image no issue occurs.
* It only happens if the image is embedded inline.
* Customer notifications are not affected by the bug

h3.Workaround
* Enable the thumbnails or send the image attached instead.
fields.summary: Notifications not being sent when an issue is created by email with inline image and thumbnail disabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* The issue comment permalink is not displayed correctly from the mobile web browser
* If you have the JIRA mobile application, it will display properly in the client

h3. Environment
* iOS v12.0.1
* JIRA Mobile v65.0.0.579

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy the permalink from the desktop view of JIRA Cloud
# Paste the link on a mobile web browser (eg. Safari / Chrome)

h3. Expected Results
The comment will be redirected will be displayed correctly in the web browser

h3. Actual Results
The following error is displayed on the web browser
 !cloud_issue_comment.PNG|thumbnail! 

(i) If you open the issue itself, you will notice that there is no feature to copy the permalink of the comment

h3.Workaround
Remove the /comment/<comment_id> so the URL looks like this - {{https://<fqdn>/plugins/servlet/mobile#issue/<issue_id>}}
fields.summary: Issue Comment Permalink Does Not Open Correctly on Mobile Web Browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, when the bug reported [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70477] happens, the user or admin doesn't get an error notification on the UI, having to rely on page inspection to have a hint of what happened.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a "Something went wrong" in the user interface when this error happens (or, alternatively, show the exact error to the user).

h3. Why this is important
Enhance the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
Inspect the page to verify what is the error.
fields.summary: As an user, I'd like to be warned of the error of the bug JRACLOUD-70477

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Considering the various different needs of users in a company when using JIRA as a whole, it's an understatement to say that all users should be able to configure the notifications.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow that not only administrators but end users, have the permission to modify the notifications.

h3. Why this is important
Admins should not need to be disturbed every time a user wishes to modify his personal notifications setup.
fields.summary: Allow Non-Admin Users to Customize Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Notifications settings can only be modified by an Admin, and although "Comments" and "Issue updated" are separated, we cannot make a distinction between various updates.

h3. Suggested Solution
We need "Issue updated" (or some new feature) to be able to make a distinction between different custom fields (Ex: Still receive email and notifications when the custom field "Priority" is modified but not when "Labels:" is modified for specific users.

h3. Why this is important
Such functionality would improve the way we can control and manage notifications, providing a more specific
fields.summary: Customize Notifications per Field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the updated navigation left sidebar, if the Cloud instance has the [Sub Task Manager|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214056/sub-task-manager-for-jira-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on, admins are unable to access the project-specific templates they had previously created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Pre req 1: Be sure your instance is using the updated navigation left sidebar;
 !updated navigation left sidebar.png|thumbnail! 
# Pre req 2: Be a Jira admin of that instance;
# Pre req 3: Have the "Sub Task Manager" add-on installed;
# Access a project.

h3. Expected Results
* The project-specific templates from "Sub Task Manager" should be accessible in the left sidebar by the admin clicking the "Add-ons" sub menu.

 !Nav v1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* There is no "Add-ons" sub menu, so admins can't access the project-specific templates from "Sub Task Manager".

 !Nav v2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
# If needed, create a globally available template;
# Open a support ticket at support.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: As an admin, I can't view the Sub Task Manager (add-on) project-specific templates in the sidebar with Navigation v2 enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to set Resolution to blank/please select in resolution. As a default resolution value is already selected, users might ignore it and proceed further.
Furthermore, the configuration of the default value applies system-wide.

h3. Suggested Solution

Setting Resolution field to blank/*please select* to make sure a user selects it.
Provide project level configuration of default resolution.

h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Unable to set Resolution to blank/please select

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to view the whole content of the text field (multi-line) if it is lengthy at a glance in an issue in the new issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to view the whole content of the text field (multi-line) if it is lengthy at a glance in an issue in the new issue view.

h3. Why this is important
Customers having lengthy content in the text field (multi-line) not able to view as it could be viewed in the old issue view. The field is added to the right-hand side column which only enables users to view 3-4 lines. Scrolling also doesn't provide the ease to view it there is a comprehensive description contained in it.
fields.summary: Ability to view all the content in Text Field (multi-line) in new issue view

fields.description:
h3.Summary

You can see your recent uploads when attempting to upload something to a JIRA ticket. Currently it is not possible to filter the recent uploads. It will be nice to be able to filter for recently uploaded files since it is not possible to do so.
fields.summary: Filtering recent uploads

fields.description: We need the ability to define which fields are displayed on a form by default, currently it seems the only way to define / force a field to show is by making it required, however id do not want it required, i simply want to force it to show on the screen.
fields.summary: Ability to define default display fields

fields.description:
It would be very beneficial to have some type of flow control such as case statement or if/then capabilities available withing the workflow for transitions and validation.  Somewhat of a combination of what you have available in "Conditions" then adding on the executable function of the transition.  

This would really help us admins with the customization and precise control of tasks as they transition through the system.
fields.summary: Flow Control in workflow Transitions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you copy a link that ends with a slash ( / ) or has an exclamation mark( ! ) and paste it in the description or comment field, it fails with the following error:
{quote}(x) *We couldn't save your comment*
 It might be empty, too long, or have invalid
 formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the
 formatting and adding it directly in the editor.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Type the following link as comment and save it:
{quote}[https://test.com/]

[https://xyz123.atlassian.net/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa]
{quote}
 # Copy the link from the comment
 # Past the link into another comment (or in the description field) and click *Save*

h3. Expected Results

Comment/description saves
h3. Actual Results

Following error appears in UI and browser's console:
 !Comment Error.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Click on the link and select *Unlink* before saving it, see screenshot below:
 !Unlink comment.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Copying link in description or comment fields fails in new Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When pasting text from any source into the comment field on the new issue view that contains a colon, the comment fails to be added. This even includes copy pasting from within the same issue. 

h3. Environment
Cloud - New Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Within Jira:*
# Create a comment within an Issue on Jira (using new issue view).
# Copy this comment including the colon.
# Paste the comment.

*External source for text:*
# Copy text including a comment from gmail or word for example.
# Paste this into comment in Jira new issue view

h3. Expected Results
Comment should appear as expected including the colon

h3. Actual Results
 !Capture.JPG|thumbnail! 

No exception found at this time in logs, will update if I find one.

h3.Workaround
# Disable the new issue view
# Manually type the colon (intermittent success, worked for me but not for customer)
fields.summary: Pasting colon from any source into comments field causes comment to fail to be added - new issue view
Rest API with Exclamation in description gets escaped

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when user would like to edit the issue , when they click *Edit* , an edit screen will pop up and the first field will be preselect. Normally , it will be "Summary" field.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if this can be removed. JIRA will not preselect any field value when open edit screen.

h3. Why this is important
 Sometimes the user will accidently edit the field and remove the previous value due to it already preselect.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Remove preselect on first field in "Edit Issue" screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Mentioning the issue in the Description or Comment, it's not converted into link if the mentioned issue is coming from a different project

h3. Environment
* This is affecting both old and new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* In an issue (eg: ABC-10), try to mention an issue from a different project (eg: TEST-2)

h3. Expected Results
The mentioned issue is converted into a link.

h3. Actual Results
The mentioned issue didn't convert into a link.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* The issue is converted into link if it's coming from the same project (eg: ABC-2)
fields.summary: Issue Link is not working if the issue is not in the same project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
CSV file exported from search results does not contain any value for custom fields with type *User Property Field*, even though the values are visible in the issue page and search results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a property and value for a user at user's account > *User Jira properties*. e.g Property: _Team_, Value: _Development_
# Create a custom field with type *User Property Field (< 255 characters)*
# Set the property added in step #1 as the default value for the field. e.g _assignee:Team_
# Add the field to issue screens
# Create a new issue and assign it to the user
# Search for issues and include the created issue
# Export a CSV file from the search results *Export Excel CSV (all fields)*

h3. Expected Results
In CSV file the issue contains value for the custom field (User Property Field)

h3. Actual Results
The custom field is empty
fields.summary: 'Export Excel CSV' does not export values of 'User Property Field' custom fields

fields.description:
Some admins would like to be able to apply a standard template to names in the summary field so that names remain consistent for issues throughout the life of a project.

I would like to suggest that we add a Jinja2 template interpreter option for the summaries of issues on a per-project, per-issue-type basis if possible.

It would be nice if this could be extended to a number of fields.
fields.summary: Allow Templates to be set for Summary Field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the site-admin unable to view the list of members in "atlassian-addons-admin" group.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if the site-admin able to view the list of member in "atlassian-addons-admin" group. They should only able to view it , but not managed the user (for example remove them from the group)

h3. Why this is important
 Provide visibility to the site-admin which user is part of "atlassian-addons-admin" group.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to view the members of "atlassian-addons-admin" group.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Activity Stream gadget is showing the right Due Date that was set, while in the Issue View, it does show.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and set a Due Date for it;
# Have the Activity Stream gadget on a dashboard.

h3. Expected Results
The Due Date should be displayed with the correct date.

h3. Actual Results
It shows the data with a difference of one day.
Example: Set to October, 20th, will be displayed as October 19th in the gadget.

 !Detail View.png|thumbnail! 

 !Activity Stream.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Activity Stream Shows Different Due Date than Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When it fails, there is a generic error message that appears that directs the user to check the information in their ticket. However, it does not tell them what field failed the validation.

h3. Suggested resolution

We would like the message to read something like: "The <field name> information you entered is incorrect. please enter a valid value".
fields.summary: Ability to edit the error message of the "Date Compare" validator

fields.description:
This can happen if the page is refreshed _while_ the sidebar/navigation is resized. Refreshing the page doesn't solve the problem.

*Workaround:*

The problem should be resolved after resizing the sidebar, as shown in the attached GIF.
fields.summary: Items in sidebar/navigation cannot be clicked

fields.description:
When setting the roles for new users, it can be really difficult for project admins to need to wade through all of the project roles that they may have needed to set for users of other projects causing the options to become polluted.

It would be optimal to be able to hide or otherwise short-list the project roles that are actually being used by the permission scheme that is currently active when setting project roles in the people tab.
fields.summary: Hide unused roles from project administration

fields.description:
When utilizing bullet points on a Text field (like the Description field) in the Old Issue View, pressing enter to generate a new line with a new bullet does not scroll down with the newly generated bullet.

This can cause some confusion and requires the user perform an additional scroll action to keep up with the newly generated bullet.

This user experience would be greatly improved if the text box would scroll with the new bullet.
fields.summary: Text Fields should scroll while using bullet points in Old Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The application links configuration allows the admin to set the links as hidden so that the links won't show in the "switch apps" button. However, within the "switch apps" option, users are allowed to click on "Home" which will navigate them to the Home page. From here, all of the hidden application links are displayed although they were hidden.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Hide apps, eg: Confluence by editing it to hidden in the application navigator
# Click "switch apps" from the menu bar, then click on Home

h3. Expected Results
The hidden apps won't be displayed
h3. Actual Results
The hidden apps are displayed
 
h3.Workaround
No workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Clicking the Home button under "Switch apps" reveals all hidden application links

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some menus under Site Administration are not translated like Billing and Discover New Products for example. To allow true internationalisation all menu's should be translated.

h3. Suggested Solution
Translate all Site Admin menus

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Translations missing for some Site Administration menus

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Project navigation on the sidebar does not work properly when viewing the issue navigator with the new Jira issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for a project (magnifying glass)
# Click on the project or access the URL directy https://site/browse/<Project_Key>
# Click on the *<- Issues and Filter* to view the project navigations

h3. Expected Results

The project navigation should be visible on the sidebar.


h3. Actual Results

The navigations on the sidebar menu is no longer project specific. 


h3.Workaround

Disable the new Jira issue view in the profile settings.
fields.summary: New view in the issue navigator breaks the project navigation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With Jira Navigation: Nav v2 enabled, if there are no existing projects it's not possible to create a 
project. The create project button does nothing.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Confirm you have a resizable navigation bar on the left (v2)
# Delete all projects
# Try and create a new project
# Nothing happens

h3. Expected Results
The project template selection screen is displayed

h3. Actual Results
Literally nothing.

No error in Splunk, no error in browser devtools
 
h3. Notes
Seems the endpoint is not even being called

h3.Workaround
Create a project from the External System Import menu whilst importing a CSV, then cancel the import
fields.summary: Cannot create a project if none exist when Jira Navigation: Nav v2 is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in *People* page https://InstanceName.atlassian.net/people/ only the following information/field is available

* Full name
* Nickname
* Job title
* Department
* Organization
* Location
* Time zone
 !people.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good to have a field for *Phone number* in the *People* page
fields.summary: Adding Phone number field in Jira's People page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Resolution field value set during issue creation is removed by Jira automatically but *Resolved* date field is left populated causing confusion and misinformation in the issue.

(i) This is not due to post-function in *Create* transition.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add *Resolution* field in issue create screen.
# Create an issue and select a resolution e.g. Done.
# Check *Resolution* field in issue view. It shows as *Unresolved* but *Resolved* date is populated.

h3. Expected result
If *Resolution* field is aimed to be cleared after issue creation, *Resolved* date should be cleared too.

h3. Current result
*Resolved* date is not cleared.

h3. Workaround
Remove *Resolution* field from issue create screen as the field is not supposed to be added or used during issue creation or even during issue edit(edit issue screen) as it will force a value to Resolution field.

A resolution should only be set during resolved issue transition and/or closed issue transition.
fields.summary: Resolution set during issue creation is removed, leaving resolved date populated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pasting screenshots no longer working in Firefox when using the new issue view.

h3. Environment
* Jira New Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue with Firefox browser
# Take a screenshot with 'Print Screen' keyboard button
# Edit "Description" field
# Use keyboard shortcut (Crtl + V) to paste the image / Right click > Paste

h3. Expected Results
The screenshot is automatically added to the issue and generates the thumbnail into the "Description" field

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

h3. Notes
* This has been tested and not working on Firefox and MS Edge

h3.Workaround
* Use Google Chrome.
fields.summary: New Issue View: Pasting screenshot No Longer Working in Some Browsers
Code formatting support for Thrift

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

In the New Jira Experience, when navigating from one tab to another in the project page, the usual behavior is that the last accessed page in the project is memorized and when the user navigates to another project and returns back to the original project, it will redirect the user back to the last opened page in the that project. Though, in the New Jira Experience, when a new Software project is created, the default page is the Issue tab "All Open Issues", the moment the "Reports" tab is opened, even if the user opens the "All Open Issues" tab back again and navigates to another project and comes back to the original project, it will redirect back to the "Reports" page always.
h3. *Environment*
 - New Jira Experience

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a new Software project > Create some dummy issues(if needed)
 # (From Jira Main-page) > Click on Projects on the left navigation bar > Click on the Project name (either on Recently viewed or the list of projects) > The default project page will be the All Issues page under the Issue tab.
 # Click on Reports tab > navigate to another project, return back it shows Reports tab(which is correct)
 # From there, click on Setting tab, Issue tab and navigate to another project, return back it still shows Reports tab.
 # Exit the instance > Login back > Access the Projects tab > Click on the Project > Still shows Reports tab as last accessed.

h3. *Expected Results*

To be able to navigate back to the correct last opened page in a Software Project
h3. *Actual Results*

Keeps navigating back to Reports tab

 

*Side Note*
- If you click on the Component tab, then it will keep bringing up the Component tab, even if you switch back to Reports tab, it still maintains the Component tab.
fields.summary: Default Page Navigation gets stuck at Report tab in JIRA Software project (New JIRA Experience)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bolding a word in a list would make the next words in a new line, if it has a sub list

h3. Environment
* New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you're on the new issue view
# Click on *See the old view*. Eg: https://example.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-5?oldIssueView=true
# Copy following text to the description field
{noformat}
# Step 1:
## boil potatoes until tender. Meanwhile heat oil in a large saucepan or frying pan and brown onion, carrot, mushrooms and mince.
# Step 2:
## Add soup mix and water, bring to the boil, cover and simmer for 10 minutes until carrots are tender. Transfer to a large baking dish.
# *Step* 3:
## drain potatoes then mash with milk and butter. Spread over mince mixture and top with cheese. Brown under a preheated grill until cheese is melted and golden.
# Step 4
## Serve with steamed green beans.
{noformat}
# *Save*

h3. Expected Results
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The bold word created a new line:
 !screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The bug only happens if it has nested list. Eg:
(/) Working fine:
{code}
# How *are* you
# I'm fine, thank you
{code}
(x) Show new line
{code}
# How *are* you
## I'm fine, thank you
{code}
fields.summary: Bold words will create new line in new issue view
